==Events==
*[[1322]] &ndash; The central tower of [[Ely Cathedral]] falls on the night of 12th-13th.
*[[1462]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Westminster (1462)|Treaty of Westminster]] is finalised between [[Edward IV of England]] and the Scottish [[Lord of the Isles]].
*[[1503]] &ndash; [[Disfida di Barletta]] &ndash; tournament between 13 Italian and 13 French knights near [[Barletta]].
*[[1542]] &ndash; [[Catherine Howard]], the fifth wife of [[Henry VIII of England]], is executed for [[adultery]].
*[[1572]] &ndash; [[Elizabeth I of England]] issues a proclamation which revokes all commissions on account of the frauds which they had fostered.
*[[1575]] &ndash; [[Henry III of France]] is crowned at [[Rheims]] and marries [[Louise de Lorraine-Vaudémont]] on the same day.
*[[1633]] &ndash; [[Galileo Galilei]] arrives in [[Rome]] for his trial before the [[Inquisition]].
*[[1660]] &ndash; With the death of Swedish King [[Charles X Gustav of Sweden|Charles X Gustav]], the Swedish government begins to seek peace with Sweden's enemies in the [[Second Northern War]] &ndash; something that Charles had refused. As his son and successor on the throne, [[Charles XI of Sweden|Charles XI]], is only four years old, a [[regency (government)|regency]] rules Sweden until 1672.
*[[1668]] &ndash; [[Spain]] recognizes [[Portugal]] as an independent nation.
*[[1689]] &ndash; [[William III of England|William]] and [[Mary II of England|Mary]] are proclaimed co-rulers of [[England]].
*[[1692]] &ndash; [[Massacre of Glencoe]]: About 78 [[Clan Donald|Macdonalds]] at [[Glen Coe]], [[Scotland]] are killed early in the morning for not promptly pledging allegiance to the new king, [[William III of England|William of Orange]].
*[[1739]] &ndash; [[Battle of Karnal]]: The army of [[History of Iran#Before the First World War|Iranian]] ruler [[Nadir Shah]] defeats the forces of the [[Mughal Empire|Mughal]] emperor of [[History of India#The Mughal era|India]], [[Muhammad Shah]].
*[[1849]] &ndash; The delegation headed by Metropolitan bishop [[Andrei Şaguna]] hands out to the Emperor [[Franz Joseph I of Austria]] the ''General Petition of Romanian leaders in [[Transylvania]], [[Banat]] and [[Bukovina]]'', which demands that the [[Romanians|Romanian nation]] be recognized.
*[[1861]] &ndash; In [[Gaeta]] the capitulation of the fortress decreeing the end of the [[Kingdom of the Two Sicilies]] is signed.
*[[1867]] &ndash; Work begins on the [[covering of the Zenne]], burying [[Brussels]]'s primary river and creating the modern central boulevards.
*[[1880]] &ndash; [[Thomas Edison]] observes the [[Edison effect]].
*[[1881]] &ndash; The [[feminist]] newspaper ''[[La Citoyenne]]'' is first published in [[Paris]] by the activist [[Hubertine Auclert]].
*[[1914]] &ndash; [[Copyright]]: In [[New York City]] the [[ASCAP|American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers]] is established to protect the copyrighted musical compositions of its members.
*[[1920]] &ndash; The [[Negro National League (1920–1931)|Negro National League]] is formed.
*[[1931]] &ndash; [[New Delhi]] becomes the capital of [[India]].
*[[1934]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] [[steamship]] ''[[Cheliuskin (ship)|Cheliuskin]]'' sinks in the [[Arctic Ocean]].
*[[1935]] &ndash; A jury in [[Flemington, New Jersey]] finds [[Bruno Hauptmann]] guilty of the [[1932]] [[kidnapping]] and [[murder]] of the [[Lindbergh kidnapping|Lindbergh baby]], the son of [[Charles Lindbergh]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[siege of Budapest]] concludes with the unconditional surrender of [[Nazi Germany|German]] and [[Kingdom of Hungary (1920-1946)|Hungarian]] forces to the [[Red Army]].
*  1945   &ndash; World War II: [[Royal Air Force]] bombers are dispatched to [[Dresden]], [[Germany]] to attack the city with a [[Bombing of Dresden in World War II|massive aerial bombardment]].
*[[1951]] &ndash; [[Korean War]]: [[Battle of Chipyong-ni]], which represented the "high-water mark" of the Chinese incursion into South Korea, commences.
*[[1954]] &ndash; [[Frank Selvy]] becomes the only [[NCAA]] [[Division I (NCAA)|Division I]] basketball player ever to score 100 points in a single game.
*[[1955]] &ndash; [[Israel]] obtains four of the seven [[Dead Sea scrolls]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; With the success of a [[nuclear test]] codenamed "[[Gerboise Bleue]]", [[France]] becomes the fourth country to possess nuclear weapons.
*  1960   &ndash; Black college students stage the first of the [[Nashville sit-ins]] at three [[lunch counters]] in [[Nashville, Tennessee]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; An allegedly [[Coso artifact|500,000-year-old rock]] is discovered near [[Olancha, California]], [[United States|US]], that appears to anachronistically encase a [[spark plug]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[United States|American]] researchers discover the [[Madrid Codex (I-II)|Madrid Codices]] by [[Leonardo da Vinci]] in the [[Biblioteca Nacional de España|National Library of Spain]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: Backed by [[United States|American]] air and artillery support, [[South Vietnam]]ese troops invade [[Laos]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; [[Sydney Hilton bombing|Hilton bombing]]: a [[bomb]] explodes in a refuse truck outside the [[Hilton Hotel]] in [[Sydney]], [[Australia]], killing two refuse collectors and a policeman.
*[[1979]] &ndash; An intense [[February 13, 1979 Windstorm|windstorm]] strikes western [[Washington (state)|Washington]] and sinks a 1/2-mile-long section of the [[Hood Canal Bridge]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; A series of [[Louisville sewer explosions|sewer explosions]] destroys more than two miles of streets in [[Louisville, Kentucky]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; The [[Río Negro massacre]] takes place in [[Guatemala]].
*[[1983]] &ndash; A [[Cinema Statuto fire|cinema fire]] in [[Turin]], Italy, kills 64 people.
*[[1984]] &ndash; [[Konstantin Chernenko]] succeeds the late [[Yuri Andropov]] as general secretary of the [[Communist Party of the Soviet Union]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[German reunification]]: An agreement is reached on a two-stage plan to reunite [[Germany]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Gulf War]]: Two laser-guided "[[smart bomb]]s" destroy the [[Amiriyah shelter massacre|Amiriyah shelter]] in [[Baghdad]]. Allied forces said the bunker was being used as a military communications outpost, but over 400 Iraqi civilians inside were killed.
*[[2000]] &ndash; The last original "[[Peanuts]]" [[comic strip]] appears in [[newspaper]]s one day after [[Charles M. Schulz]] dies.
*[[2001]] &ndash; An [[2001 El Salvador earthquakes|earthquake]] measuring 6.6 on the [[Richter Scale]] hits [[El Salvador]], killing at least 400.
*[[2004]] &ndash; The [[Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics]] announces the discovery of the universe's largest known [[diamond]], [[white dwarf]] [[star]] ''[[BPM 37093]]''. Astronomers named this star "Lucy" after [[The Beatles]]' song "[[Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds]]".
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[Republic of China|Taiwan]] opposition leader [[Ma Ying-jeou]] resigns as the chairman of the [[Kuomintang]] party after being indicted on charges of embezzlement during his tenure as the mayor of [[Taipei]]; Ma also announces his candidacy for the [[Republic of China presidential election, 2008|2008 presidential election]].
*[[2008]] &ndash; Australian Prime Minister [[Kevin Rudd]] makes a historic apology to the [[Indigenous Australians]] and the [[Stolen Generations]].
*[[2010]] &ndash; [[2010 Pune bombing|A bomb explodes]] in the city of [[Pune]], [[Maharashtra]], [[India]], killing 17 and injuring 60 more.
*[[2011]] &ndash; For the first time in more than 100 years the [[Confederated Tribes of the Umatilla Indian Reservation|Umatilla]], an [[American Indian tribe]], are able to hunt and harvest a [[bison]] just outside [[Yellowstone National Park]], restoring a centuries-old tradition guaranteed by a [[treaty]] signed in 1855.
*[[2012]] &ndash; The [[European Space Agency]] (ESA) conducted the first launch of the European ''[[Vega (launcher)|Vega]]'' rocket from Europe's spaceport in [[Kourou]], [[French Guiana]].
*[[2013]] A [[South Airlines Flight 8971|plane crash]] kills 5 people and injures 9 others in [[Donetsk]], [[Ukraine]].
